title: Polish złoty
summary: The złoty (Polish: [ˈzwɔtɨ] (listen);[2] sign: zł; code: PLN) is the official currency and legal tender of Poland. It is subdivided into 100 grosz (gr).[lower-alpha 1] The widely recognised English form of the currency name is the Polish zloty.[3] It is the most traded currency in Central and Eastern Europe and ranks 22nd in the foreign exchange market.[4][5][6]
